  • minstens 1 module volgen
  • minstens 1 module volgen met 3 uur achter het stuur (ecologisch rijden of defensief rijden).

  • het vervoer van gevaarlijke goederen (voor 14 kredietpunten)
  • het vervoer van dieren (voor 7 kredietpunten)
  • omgang met personen met een handicap (voor 7 kredietpunten).

The training pathway to qualify as a type C energy expert, which is the subject of the application for accreditation, must meet the following conditions:

  1. Include substantive training, covering at least the legislative framework, the determination of the building’s energy performance index, the possible recommendations for cost-effective improvement of the building’s energy performance and the operation of the web application of the energy performance database.
  2. Give at least one demo, using the web application to explain the procedure for accreditation as a type C energy expert and for drawing up an energy performance certificate for public buildings.

In order to be accredited as an examination body by VEKA, the training institution is also required to submit an application for accreditation as an examination body to VEKA. The examination addresses at least the topics that are covered in the basic training.

Because the training institution exchanges personal data of the energy experts, the provisions of the Act of 30 July 2018 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data must be observed.

beschrijving.en:
In order to be accredited as a training institution by the Energy and Climate Agency of Flanders (VEKA), the training institution must meet at least the following conditions:

  1. Have instructors who are knowledgeable about energy performance certificate legislation and who are tasked with shaping the content of the continuing education.
  2. Have a complaints handling procedure in place as well as a system for evaluating the continuing education. The application for accreditation is to provide a brief description and information on the approach.
  3. Have a plan of action in place for organising a continuing education offer for energy experts.

A training institution must also be independent from manufacturers and installers.

As the training institution exchanges personal data of the energy experts, the provisions of the Act of 30 July 2018 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data must be observed.

In order to be accredited, a quality organisation for ventilation reporting must meet the following conditions:

  • The quality organisation is to have a qualification procedure in place for ventilation reporters. As a minimum, this procedure is to consist of an optional training course, a mandatory theoretical examination and a mandatory practical examination.
  • The quality organisation is to ensure the quality of ventilation reporting by carrying out a minimum number of inspections/checks each year combined with efficient enforcement. The quality organisation is to carry out at least 10% desktop checks and 10% on-site inspections each year. These inspections/checks are both random and targeted, so that 90% of active ventilation reporters are subjected to one desktop check and one on-site inspection at least once a year. At least half of the on-site inspections are carried out to examine the accuracy of the reported mechanical flows. The quality organisation is to ensure that ventilation reporters, when sending the results of the reading, are unable to know whether these results will be subject to a subsequent check or inspection.
  • The quality organisation is to have a database of delivered declarations of conformity. This database must be available for consultation by the parties involved as well as the administration. The data security of this database must be guaranteed and its management must be in compliance with privacy laws. A policy with associated procedures must also be in place to ensure the confidentiality of sensitive information.
  • The quality organisation must be impartial and is not allowed to have any members or directors who draw up ventilation reports themselves.

  1. Beschikken over lesgevers die kennis hebben over energieprestatieregelgeving en die belast worden met het inhoudelijk vorm geven van de permanente vorming.
  2. Beschikken over een systeem voor het behandelen van klachten en een systeem voor het evalueren van de permanente vorming. De erkenningsaanvraag geeft een korte omschrijving en informatie over de aanpak weer.
  3. Beschikken over een plan van aanpak wat betreft het inrichten van een aanbod permanente vorming voor verslaggevers.

Een vormingsinstelling moet zich daarnaast ook onafhankelijk opstellen van fabrikanten en installateurs.

    Vlaams Energie- en Klimaatagentschap
    Erkenningsaanvraag Vorming EPB
    Graaf de Ferrarisgebouw - 7de verdieping
    Koning Albert II-laan 20 bus 17
    1000 Brussel
  • Step 3. The training institution submits the complete application file (above form + attachments) in digital form by e-mail to veka@vlaanderen.be, with ‘Erkenningsaanvraag Vorming EPB’ as its subject line to enable VEKA to swiftly process the application.

To be recognised as a training centre, the training centre must fulfil:

  • general recognition conditions that apply to all recognitions relating to the environment
    • in the 3 years that precede the application for the Flemish recognition certificate, the applicant has not been convicted of a criminal offence in a member state of the European Economic Area, for infringements of the environmental legislation concerning the use of the recognition.
    • in the 2 years that precede the application for the Flemish recognition certificate, no recognition with the same object was revoked due to infringement of the obligations associated with that recognition.
  • special recognition conditions
    • have sound procedures in place to organise the examination
    • have suitable technical personnel
    • organise a regulatory examination jury.

Validity period and obligations

The recognition is valid for an indefinite period. The training centre must meet the following obligations to retain recognition:

  • provide quality training
  • guarantee objectivity and independence
  • organise training and examinations as prescribed
  • have the necessary infrastructure in place to organise the examination
  • award certificates and submit the examination file to the competent authorities
  • hold insurance for third-party liability, including professional liability, in connection with the use of the recognition

Ondernemingen in de lokale diensteneconomie:

  • bieden inschakelingstrajecten aan
  • stellen minimaal vijf voltijds equivalente doelgroepwerknemers op jaarbasis tewerk
  • hebben één van deze rechtsvormen: vzw, publiekrechtelijke rechtspersoon, vennootschap met sociaal oogmerk, intergemeentelijk samenwerkingsverband met rechtspersoonlijkheid
  • hanteren een transparante en kwalitatieve bedrijfsvoering
  • baten lokale diensten uit.

Lokale-diensteneconomieondernemingen die naast hun activiteiten in het kader van dit decreet ook andere (commerciële of niet-economische) activiteiten uitoefenen, richten een sui-generisafdeling op.

De lokale diensteneconomie-onderneming begeleidt de doelgroepwerknemer via gekwalificeerde begeleiding, met het oog op professionele ontwikkeling en doorstroom naar het reguliere arbeidscircuit.
